change.changenote: Section 1 definition "collateral", paragraph (c) BEFORE amended by 378/2012, effective March 18, 2013.

paragraph.paragraphtext: authorized under the Family Relations Act, Homeowner Interest Assistance Act, Land Tax Deferment Act or Manufactured Home Act, the manufactured home that is the subject of the registration,

change.changenote: Section 1 definition "debtor", paragraph (c) BEFORE amended by 378/2012, effective March 18, 2013.

paragraph.paragraphtext: authorized under the Family Relations Act, Homeowner Interest Assistance Act, Land Tax Deferment Act or Manufactured Home Act, the person against whose interest in a manufactured home the registration applies,

change.changenote: Section 1 definition "secured party", paragraph (c) BEFORE amended by 378/2012, effective March 18, 2013.

paragraph.paragraphtext: authorized under the Family Relations Act, Homeowner Interest Assistance Act, Land Tax Deferment Act or Manufactured Home Act, >the person in whose favour the interest in a manufactured home is registered,

change.changenote: Section 1 definitions of "accounts due", "chargeholder", "contractor", "contractor's charge", "contractor's lien", "forest products", "forest products owner", "lienholder", "subcontractor" and "subcontractor's charge" were added by 141/2013, effective April 1, 2013.
Section 1 definition of "collateral" BEFORE amended by 141/2013, effective April 1, 2013.

definition.def: , when used in relation to a registration, means, if the registration is

paragraph.paragraphtext: in respect of a security interest, the personal property that is subject to the security interest and includes proceeds unless the context indicates otherwise,
authorized under the Sale of Goods Act, the goods or documents of title that are the subject of the registration,
authorized under the Family Law Act, Homeowner Interest Assistance Act, Land Tax Deferment Act or Manufactured Home Act, the manufactured home that is the subject of the registration,
authorized under the Land Title Act, the land that is the subject of the registration, or
authorized under the Repairers Lien Act, the motor vehicle, aircraft, boat or outboard motor that is the subject of the registration;

change.changenote: Section 1 definition of "debtor" BEFORE amended by 141/2013, effective April 1, 2013.

definition.def: , when used in relation to a registration, means, if the registration is

paragraph.paragraphtext: in respect of a security interest, the debtor, as defined under the Act, to whom the registration applies,

authorized under the Sale of Goods Act, the person who, having sold goods, continues or is in possession of the goods, or of the documents of title to the goods, that are the subject of the registration,

authorized under the Family Law Act, Homeowner Interest Assistance Act, Land Tax Deferment Act or Manufactured Home Act, the person against whose interest in a manufactured home the registration applies,
authorized under the Land Title Act, the person who owns the interest in land to which the registration applies, or
authorized under the Repairers Lien Act, the person having the interest in the collateral against which the lien is claimed under the Repairers Lien Act;

change.changenote: Section 1 definition of "secured party" BEFORE amended by 141/2013, effective April 1, 2013.

definition.def: , when used in relation to a registration, means, if the registration is

paragraph.paragraphtext: in respect of a security interest, the secured party, as defined under the Act, to whom the registration applies,

authorized under the Sale of Goods Act, the person who, having bought goods, leaves the goods or the documents of title to the goods that are the subject of the registration in the possession of the seller,
authorized under the Family Law Act, Homeowner Interest Assistance Act, Land Tax Deferment Act or Manufactured Home Act, the person in whose favour the interest in a manufactured home is registered,
authorized under the Land Title Act, the person in whose favour the interest in the uncrystallized floating charge is registered, or
authorized under the Repairers Lien Act, the garage keeper in whose favour the lien is registered;

change.changenote: Section 1 (1) definitions of "base debtor", "block number", "characters" and "registering party code" BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: base debtor means, in relation to a change made by a financing change statement to a registration, the first debtor listed on the base registration;
block number means the number that is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: assigned to an entry in the data base of the registry, and
shown on a verification statement or search result;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: characters means alphabetic or numeric characters and, except as permitted under section 6 (b) or (c) or 43, does not include punctuation marks or symbols;
registering party code, when used in relation to a registering party, means the number assigned by the registrar to the registering party under section 46 or 47;

change.changenote: Section 1 (1) definition of "registering party" BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the person submitting a financing statement or financing change statement for registration is the secured party or an employee of the secured party, the secured party, or
if the person submitting the financing statement or financing change statement is not a person referred to in paragraph (a), the person submitting the form;

change.changenote: Section 1 (2) definition of "verification statement" BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a statement sent by the registrar under section 49, or
any online confirmation of a registration.

change.changenote: Section 3 (c) BEFORE amended by 81/2013, effective March 1, 2013.

paragraph.paragraphtext: an interest or lien under section 63 of the Family Relations Act, section 35 or 36 of the Manufactured Home Act or section 7 of the Land Tax Deferment Act;

change.changenote: Section 3 (f) BEFORE repealed by 81/2013, effective March 1, 2013.

paragraph.paragraphtext: an interest under section 5 of Homeowners Interest Assistance Act.

change.changenote: Section 3 (c) BEFORE amended by 378/2012, effective March 18, 2013.

paragraph.paragraphtext: an interest or lien under section 63 of the Family Relations Act, section 27 or 28 of the Manufactured Home Act or section 7 of the Land Tax Deferment Act;

change.changenote: Section 3 (g), (h) and (i) were added by 141/2013, effective April 1, 2013.
Section 4 (b) (part) BEFORE amended by 141/2013, effective April 1, 2013.

paragraph.paragraphtext: if the registration is in relation to an interest referred to in section 3 (a) or (b),

change.changenote: Section 4 (f.1) and (f.2) were added by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.
Section 5 (b) and (c) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the birthdate of a debtor with the last 2 digits of the number of the year entered first followed by the month and then the day;
the registering party code for, or the full name and full mailing address of, the registering party.

change.changenote: Section 5 (d) was added by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.
Section 6 (b) and (c) BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the debtor is an individual, no punctuation marks, other than a hyphen or apostrophe, may be entered as part of the debtor's name,
if the debtor is a business debtor,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: commas or periods must not be entered as part of the debtor's name, and
other symbols set out in Schedule 1 must not be entered as part of the debtor's name unless it is necessary to do so to comply with section 8 (1), and

change.changenote: Section 7 (1) (a) to (c) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the debtor's full surname or, if that surname exceeds 25 characters, the first 25 characters of that name;
the debtor's full first given name or, if that first given name exceeds 15 characters, the first 15 characters of that name;
the debtor's full second given name or, if that second given name exceeds 15 characters, the first 15 characters of that name.

change.changenote: Section 7 (2) (a) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the debtor's full name or, if that name exceeds 25 characters, the first 25 characters of that name;

change.changenote: Section 8 (6) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A name may contain the abbreviations set out in Column 1 below, which abbreviations may be used instead of the information set out opposite those abbreviations in Column 2 below:

change.changenote: Section 8 (7) BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a business debtor's name exceeds 70 characters, only the first 70 characters of the full name are to be entered.

change.changenote: Section 10 (2) and (4) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, under subsection (1), the serial number for collateral is to be a serial number or vehicle identification number permanently marked on, or attached to, the collateral by the manufacturer but the collateral does not have such a serial number or vehicle identification number, the serial number is any number of at least 6 characters that is permanently marked on, or permanently attached to, the collateral.
A description of collateral referred to in subsection (3) may include the last 2 digits of the model year of the collateral.

change.changenote: Section 10 (3) (a) and (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the 2-character code, set out in Schedule 2, that is applicable to that type of collateral;
subject to section 12 (5), the last 25 characters of the serial number of the collateral;

change.changenote: Section 12 (3) BEFORE repealed by 81/2013, effective March 1, 2013.

subsection.subsectiontext: If the registration is authorized under the Homeowner Interest Assistance Act, an entry to that effect is required.

change.changenote: Section 12 (4) BEFORE amended by 81/2013, effective March 1, 2013.

subsection.subsectiontext: If the government registers a lien under section 35 or 36 of the Manufactured Home Act, an entry to that effect is required, and no entries are required respecting the year, make or model of the manufactured home.

change.changenote: Section 12 (4.1) was added by 141/2013, effective April 1, 2013.
Part 3 heading BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.
Part 3, Divisions 1 to 3 headings BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.
Section 13 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Required information for a change or amendment of registration
bcl:section.bcl:text: The entries that are required to change or amend a registration under Division 2 or 3 include the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the number that was assigned by the registrar to the base registration;
the name of the base debtor exactly as entered on the base registration;
the registering party code for, or the full name and full mailing address of, the person seeking the change or amendment.

change.changenote: Section 14 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In addition to the entries required under section 13, a person seeking a change to or an amendment of a registration may enter a reference number for the person's own purposes.

change.changenote: Section 15 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This Division applies if changes are required to a registration.

change.changenote: Section 16 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: If the change being sought under section 15 is the transfer all of a secured party's interest in the collateral to which the registration applies, the following entries are required:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for the secured party transferring the interest,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the secured party's block number, and
the secured party code, or the full name, of the secured party as that code or name appears on the current registration;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for the secured party to whom the interest is being transferred, the secured party code, or the full name and full mailing address, of the secured party.

change.changenote: Section 17 (1) and (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the change being sought under section 15 is the transfer of all of a debtor's interest in the collateral to which the registration applies, the following entries are required:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the block number and the name of the debtor whose interest is being transferred as it appears on the current registration;
the name of the debtor to whom the interest in the collateral has been or is to be transferred, in accordance with Division 2 of Part 2, and that debtor's full mailing address.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In addition to the entries required under subsection (1), a person wishing to effect a registration referred to in this section may enter, in relation to a debtor who is an individual, the debtor's birthdate with the year entered first followed by the month and then the day.

change.changenote: Section 18 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: If the change being sought under section 15 is the release of one or more debtors, the following entries are required for each debtor to be released:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the block number of the debtor;
the name of the debtor as it appears on the current registration.

change.changenote: Section 19 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: If the change being sought under section 15 is the discharge of certain collateral from the registration, the following entries are required for each item of collateral to be discharged:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the item is serial numbered goods, the following as it appears on the current registration:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the block number of the item;
the serial number of the item;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the item is general collateral, a description of the general collateral as it appears on the current registration.

change.changenote: Section 20 (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: If the change being sought under section 15 is the addition of collateral to a registration in respect of a security interest, the following entries are required:

change.changenote: Section 21 (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: If the change being sought under section 15 is the substitution of one or more items of collateral in a registration in respect of a security interest for one or more other items of collateral, the following entries are required:

change.changenote: Section 21 (a) and (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for every item of serial numbered goods that is to be discharged, the following as it appears on the current registration:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the block number of the item;
the serial number of the item;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for every item of general collateral that is to be discharged, a description of the general collateral as it appears on the current registration;

change.changenote: Section 22 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This Division applies if amendments are required to a registration.

change.changenote: Section 23 (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: If the amendment being sought under section 22 is to reflect a subordination agreement affecting a security interest, the following entries are required:

change.changenote: Section 24 (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transfer of part of a secured party's interest
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the amendment being sought under section 22 is to reflect a transfer of part of a secured party's interest in all or part of the collateral, the following entries are required:

change.changenote: Section 25 was renumbered as 25 (1) by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.
Section 25 (1) (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the amendment being sought under section 22 is to reflect a transfer of part of the collateral to a new debtor, the following entries are required:

change.changenote: Section 25 (2) was added by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.
Section 26 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Change in a debtor's name or address
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the amendment being sought under section 22 is to reflect a change in a debtor's name or address, the following entries are required:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the words "debtor name/address change";
if the registering party wishes to delete the previous debtor name or address,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the block number of the debtor, and
the name of the debtor as it appears on the current registration;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the debtor's name, in accordance with Division 2 of Part 2, and the debtor's full mailing address.

change.changenote: Section 27 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Change in a secured party's name or address
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the amendment being sought under section 22 is to reflect, in relation to a single registration, a change in a secured party's name or address, the following entries are required:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the words "secured party name/address change";
the block number of the secured party;
the secured party code, or the full name of the secured party, as it appears on the current registration;
the secured party's full name and full mailing address.

change.changenote: Section 28 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Amendment of a trust indenture indicator
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the amendment being sought under section 22 is to revise the current registration's entry respecting whether or not the registration is in relation to a trust indenture, the following entries are required:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the words "amendment to trust indenture indicator";
the correct information.

change.changenote: Section 29 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Adding a debtor's name and address
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the amendment being sought under section 22 is to add a debtor's name and address, the following entries are required:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the words "add debtor name and address";
the new debtor's name, in accordance with Division 2 of Part 2, and the new debtor's full mailing address.

change.changenote: Section 30 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: If the amendment being sought under section 22 is to reflect a change other than one referred to in Division 2 of this Part, or is to reflect a combination of 2 or more of the changes referred to in one or both of this Division and Division 2, the following entries are required:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a description of the type of changes being sought;
if a secured party, a debtor or collateral that is serial numbered goods is being deleted, the block number of the deletion;
the exact information to be deleted as it appears on the current registration being amended;
the exact information to be added in accordance with any applicable instructions in this Part.

change.changenote: Section 31 (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: If a change to or an amendment of a registration is required by a court order, the following entries are required:

change.changenote: Section 32 (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Changes or amendments to a registration made by the registrar under subsection (1) are effective only from the time when the changes or amendments are made.

change.changenote: Section 33 (1) (part) BEFORE amended by 141/2013, effective April 1, 2013.

subsection.subsectiontext: If the registration of an interest under the Act or under section 30 of the Sale of Goods Act is to be renewed, the following entries are required:

change.changenote: Section 33 (1) (b) and (d) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name of the base debtor exactly as entered on the base registration;
the registering party code for, or the full name and full mailing address of, the person seeking the renewal.

change.changenote: Section 33 (1) (e) was added by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.
Section 34 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In addition to the entries required under section 33, a person seeking a renewal of a registration may enter a reference number for the person's own purposes.

change.changenote: Section 35 (b) and (c) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name of the base debtor exactly as entered on the base registration;
the registering party code for, or the full name and full mailing address of, the person seeking the discharge.

change.changenote: Section 35 (d) was added by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.
Section 6 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In addition to the entries required under section 35, a person seeking a discharge of a registration may enter a reference number for the person's own purposes.

change.changenote: Section 40 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Unless this regulation provides otherwise, if this regulation requires a serial number to be entered, the full serial number must be entered, but if the serial number has too many characters for the space to be filled the last 25 characters of the serial number are to be entered.

change.changenote: Sections 41 to 44 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Unless this regulation provides otherwise, if this regulation requires a date to be entered, the following information is to be entered in the following order:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the 4 digits of the number of the year;
the first 3 letters of the name of the month;
the day of the month in numerals.

bcl:section.bcl:text: If this regulation requires an address to be entered and the address to be given is not a Canadian address, the following is to be entered to replace that part of the address that would otherwise identify the province or territory:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the address is in the United States, the abbreviation for the state in accordance with Schedule 3;
if the address is in a jurisdiction other than the United States, the first 4 characters of the English version of the name of the country.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), the information required or allowed by this regulation to be entered is to be entered without punctuation marks, symbols or abbreviations.
Subject to sections 6 (b) and (c) and 10 (1) (h) and (i), the punctuation marks or symbols set out in Column 2 of Schedule 1 may be entered in any electronic form referred to in this regulation.

The abbreviations set out in Column 2 of Schedule 3 may be entered in an address or in a description of collateral instead of the information set out opposite those abbreviations in Column 1 of Schedule 3.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person must not, in completing an entry mentioned in Column 1 of Schedule 4, use a number of characters that exceeds the number of characters mentioned for that entry in Column 2 of Schedule 4.

change.changenote: Section 46 (1) BEFORE amended by 81/2013, effective March 1, 2013.

subsection.subsectiontext: The registrar may assign a code to a secured party or registering party.

change.changenote: Section 46 (1) and (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The registrar, on application in Form 3 by a registering party or secured party, may assign a code to a secured party or registering party.

If a secured party or registering party enters a code in addition to a name and address, and there is a conflict between the name or address to which the code refers and the name or address specified in the entry, then, to the extent of the conflict, the name or address specified in the entry is of no effect.

change.changenote: Section 47 (1) and (3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A registering party or secured party may submit to the registrar an application in Form 3 to change the person's registering party code or the secured party code.

A registering party or secured party who has a registering party code or a secured party code may submit to the registrar an application in Form 3 to change one or both of the name information and the address information in the possession of the registrar in relation to that code.

change.changenote: Section 47 (4) (a) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: replaces that person's old information in all past registrations in which that old information was used, and

change.changenote: Section 48 (a) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the registering party code or secured party code entersame ed is the code assigned to the registering party tendering the registration or assigned to the identified secured party, or

change.changenote: Section 49 (0.1) was added by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.
Section 49 (1) and (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a registration is changed under Part 3, the registrar may send a verification statement that confirms the information in the registry to the persons who are named as secured parties in the registration.
If a registration is discharged under Part 5, the registrar may send a verification statement that confirms that discharge to all of the persons who are named as secured parties in the registration.

change.changenote: Section 57 (5) BEFORE amended by 81/2013, effective March 1, 2013.

subsection.subsectiontext: A notice to the registrar under section 36 (9) of the Manufactured Home Act must be in Form 8.

change.changenote: Section 57 (6) and (7) were added by 141/2013, effective April 1, 2013.
Section 57 (2), (4) and (7) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A notice to the registrar under section 50 (5) of the Act must be in Form 5.
A notice to the registrar under section 5 (3) of the Repairers Lien Act must be in Form 7.
A notice to the registrar under section 16 (3) of the Forestry Service Providers Protection Act must be in Form 10.

change.changenote: Section 58 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 69 (4) of the Act, the debtor or person disclosed as debtor in a registration is deemed to have suffered damages of at least $200 for a cause of action referred to in that subsection.

change.changenote: Schedule 1 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.
Schedule 2 item BEFORE amended by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.
Schedules 3 and 4 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:centertext.in:strong: Number of Characters Allowed for Forms and Screens

oasis:entry.oasis:line: Number of Lines of General Collateral

change.changenote: Schedule 5, Form 3 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 326/2021, effective January 25, 2022.

bcl:centertext.in:strong:
SECURED/REGISTERING PARTY CODES
APPLICATION AND CHANGES

oasis:entry.oasis:line:
APPLICATION REQUEST
Please issue a code to the following name and address:
Authorization to debit future charges for Personal Property Registry services on this code to BC OnLine Deposit Account # ..............

CHANGE REQUEST
Secured/registering Party Code: ....................
Name of Code Holder: .............................................................................................................................
[ ] Please change our code and advise us of the new code assigned.
[ ] Please change the name/address of the secured/registering party code holder and update any prior registration in which the code was used to reflect this change.
[ ] Authorization to add BC OnLine Deposit Account # ........ to the above code for future billings for Personal Property Registry services.
Previous name/address

SEND TO:
Secured/Registering Party Codes
Personal Property Registry
Ministry of Finance
P.O. Box 9431 Stn Prov Govt
Victoria, BC V8W 9V3

change.changenote: Schedule 5, Form 4 BEFORE amended by 81/2013, effective March 1, 2013.

centertext.strong:
DEMAND FOR DISCHARGE
UNDER THE PERSONAL PROPERTY SECURITY ACT

centertext.em:
(Section 57 (1) Personal Property Security Regulation
and Section 50 (3) Personal Property Security Act)

form.lefttext: Under section 50 (3) of the Personal Property Security Act, I hereby demand that the [strike out those of the following forms that do not apply] financing statement or financing change statement registered by you, bearing registration number .......... and registered on the .......... day of .........., ..., claiming an interest as follows:
[You may put the phrase "all collateral" here if you wish to demand that all the collateral described on a financing statement or financing change statement be discharged.]
be discharged/partially discharged [choose one] not later than 15 days from service of this notice.

change.changenote: Schedule 5, Form 5 BEFORE amended by 81/2013, effective March 1, 2013.

centertext.strong:
NOTICE TO REGISTRAR TO DISCHARGE
UNDER THE PERSONAL PROPERTY SECURITY ACT

centertext.em:
(Section 57 (2) Personal Property Security Regulation
and Section 50 (5) Personal Property Security Act)

form.lefttext: Pursuant to section 50 (5) of the Personal Property Security Act I, [here state full name and address], require you to serve a notice to discharge or partially discharge on the secured party(ies) named in the [strike out those of the following that do not apply] financing statement or financing change statement bearing registration number .......... and registered on the .......... day of .........., ......... with respect to the collateral described as follows:
[You may put the phrase "all collateral" here if you wish to demand that all the collateral described on a financing statement, or financing change statement be discharged.]

I served a written demand on the secured party(ies) by [here state method of service] on [here state the secured party(ies) address where you served the written demand] and 15 days have expired from service of the demand.
I claim my interest as [here state whether as owner, debtor or other person having an interest in the collateral.]

change.changenote: Schedule 5, Form 5, Section 5 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 106/2015, effective July 1, 2015.

bcl:schedule.bcl:lefttext: 5. I have an interest in property that falls under the collateral description in the financing statement, as follows:

change.changenote: Schedule 5, Forms 6 and 7 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 106/2015, effective July 1, 2015.

bcl:centertext.in:em:
(Section 57 (3) Personal Property Security Regulation
and Section 5 Repairers Lien Act)

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: Under section 5 of the Repairers Lien Act I hereby demand that the repairers lien financing statement registered by you, bearing registration number .......... and registered on the .......... day of .........., ..., claiming an interest in collateral as follows:
[You may put the phrase "all collateral" here if you wish to demand that all the collateral described on a repairers lien financing statement be discharged.]
be discharged/partially discharged [choose one] not later than 15 days from service of this notice.

bcl:centertext.in:strong:
NOTICE TO REGISTRAR TO DISCHARGE
A REPAIRERS LIEN

bcl:centertext.in:em:
(Section 57 (4) Personal Property Security Regulation
and Section 5 (3) Repairers Lien Act)

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: Under section 5 (3) of the Repairers Lien Act I, [state full name and address here], require you to serve a notice to discharge or partially discharge on the garage keeper(s) named in the repairers lien financing statement, bearing registration number .......... and registered on the .......... day of .........., ..., with respect to the collateral described as follows:
[You may put the phrase "all collateral" here if you wish to demand that all the collateral described on a repairers lien financing statement be discharged.]

I served a written demand on the garage keeper(s) by [here state method of service] at [here state the garage keeper's address where you served the written demand] and 15 days have expired from service of the demand.
I claim my interest as [here state as owner, debtor or other person having an interest in the collateral.]

change.changenote: Schedule 5, Form 8 BEFORE amended by 81/2013, effective March 1, 2013.

centertext.strong:
NOTICE TO REGISTRAR TO DISCHARGE A TAX LIEN
UNDER THE MANUFACTURED HOME ACT

centertext.em:
(Section 57 (5) Personal Property Security Regulation
and Section 36 (9) Manufactured Home Act)

form.lefttext: Pursuant to section 36 (9) of the Manufactured Home Act I, [here state full name and address], require you to serve a notice to discharge or partially discharge on the collector or secured party(ies) named in the financing statement bearing registration number .......... and registered on the .......... day of .........., ..., with respect to the collateral described as follows:
[You may put the phrase "all collateral" here if you wish to demand that all the collateral described on a financing statement be discharged.]
I am registered under section 15 of the Manufactured Home Act as owner of the manufactured home in question.

change.changenote: Schedule 5, Form 9 was added by 141/2013, effective April 1, 2013.
Schedule 5, Form 10 was added by 141/2013, effective April 1, 2013.
